question: 19) EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Chemically, what is the difference between limestone and dolomite? W) Limestone is a carbonate rock containing only calcium, while dolomite contains both calcium and magnesium X) Limestone is a carbonate rock containing only magnesium, while dolomite contains only calcium Y) Limestone is a carbonate rock containing both calcium and magnesium, while dolomite contains only calcium Z) Limestone is a carbonate rock containing only calcium, while dolomite contains only magnesium
answer:
W) LIMESTONE IS A CARBONATE ROCK CONTAINING ONLY CALCIUM, WHILE
DOLOMITE CONTAINS BOTH CALCIUM AND MAGNESIUM
